点距（dot pitch）（DOT PITCH）是指荫罩板上两个最接近的同色荧光点之间的直线距离。点距（dot pitch）是显像管最重要的技术参数之一，他的单位为毫米。

entry.def: A dot is a very small round mark, for example one that is used as the top part of the letter 'i', as a full stop, or as a decimal point.

entry.tran: (因距离远而看起来)似小点之物，点状物
entry.def: You can refer to something that you can see in the distance and that looks like a small round mark as a dot .

example.ex: Soon they were only dots above the hard line of the horizon.
example.tran: 很快他们就成了地平线上的几个小点了。

entry.tran: 散布于;星罗棋布于;遍布
entry.def: When things dot a place or an area, they are scattered or spread all over it.

example.ex: Small coastal towns dot the landscape.
example.tran: 这一地区滨海小镇星罗棋布。

entry.def: If you arrive somewhere or do something on the dot, you arrive there or do it at exactly the time that you were supposed to.

example.ex: They appeared on the dot of 9.50 pm as always...
example.tran: 他们和往常一样在晚上9点50分准时出现。

example.ex: At nine o' clock on the dot, they have breakfast.
example.tran: 他们在 9 点钟准时吃早饭。

entry.tran: (在耗时且无关紧要的事情上)一丝不苟，注重细节
entry.def: If you say that someone dots the i's and crosses the t's, you mean that they pay great attention to every small detail in a task; often used to express your annoyance because such detailed work seems unnecessary and takes a very long time.
The year dot is used to mean a very long time ago.

example.ex: You've wanted to be a barrister since the year dot.
example.tran: 很久以前你就一直想成为一名辩护律师了。
